chargeHist.descr: Child Sexual Exploitation - Produce, Perform, etc.

result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn M Hoppe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to Court costs and surcharges, including Child Pornography surcharges (4 image surcharges). Paid in full. Balance of cash bail to be refunded to poster.

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e. bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Comply with sex offender registry.
Sex Offender Treatment.
Any other condition(s) deemed appropriate by Agent.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt: To parties regarding destruction of exhibit 1 from motion hearing held on 1/25/16.  The exhibit to be destroyed per statute.  If no response filed by 12/19/16 exhibits will be destoryed. Copy of exhibit list attached.

Defendant Shawn M Hoppe in court with attorney Mark P. Powers.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   The Defendant was sentenced to the following: 

Count #2:

IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

4 YEARS 6 MONTHS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 3  days) (Defendant remanded into custody and sentence to begin forthwith).
  -  3 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  1 YEAR 6 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Any other condition deemed appropriate by agent. 
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
*Any other condition deemed appropriate by agent.
*Comply with sex offender registry.
*Sex Offender Treatment.

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (apply cash bail);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (apply cash bail);

OTHER SURCHARGE: Child pornography surcharge 4 images @ $500.00 for images. (apply cash bail and balance to be refunded to poster).

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Defendant Shawn M Hoppe in court with attorney Mark P. Powers.  Brian Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 2,  Court finds defendant guilty. Defendant Shawn M Hoppe in court with attorney Mark P. Powers.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court calls the case to address the Miranda motion filed by Attorney Powers.  The State calls its Paula Hoffa with the Village of Hartland Police Department.  The witness is sworn in and testifies.  Exhibit #1 is marked.  Attorney Juech questions the Defendant.  Attorney Powers questions the witness. Re-direct by the State.  Re-direct by the Defense.   Exhibit #2 is marked.  Exhibits #1 and #2 are received.  The State rests.  Attorney Powers calls its witness: the Defendant Shawn Hoppe.  The Witness is sworn in and testifies.  Court conducts the colloquy on the defendant's right to testify and not testify.  Defendant understands his right to testify or not testify.  Defendant chooses to testify. Court finds the defendant is freely and knowingly making his decision.  Court accepts the defendant's right to testify.  Attorney Powers questions the witness.  Attorney Juech questions the witness.  Re-direct by the State.  The Defense rests.   The Witness is excused.  The Court will order a written decision prior to the jury status hearing/jury trial dates.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.

Defendant Shawn M Hoppe in court with attorney Mark P. Powers.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Powers requests the Court address the miranda motion at a future date.  The State does not object and the Court grants the request. The Court calls the matter to address the motion to suppress filed by Attorney Powers.  Witness Called:  Detective David Feyer, Waukesha Police Department is sworn and testified.  Witness called:  Detective Paula Hoffa, Village of Hartland Police Department is sworn and testified. Testimony Deemed Closed. Defense presents closing arguments.  State presents closing arguments.  The court orders the following:  The motion to suppress is denied by the Court for reasons stated on the record.   The parties address the motion to dismiss the mandatory minimum penalty enhancer.    The Court has reviewed the brief and denies the motion for reasons stated on the record.   Attorney Powers requests the court The court set the miranda motion.  The Court advises the State to provide  the discs to the court by Tuesday, November 24, 2015.  Motion hearing scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
